categories.name: Password Security
categories.description: Learn about creating and managing strong passwords

questions.question: What is the minimum recommended length for a strong password?
questions.explanation: A strong password should be at least 12 characters long to provide adequate security against brute force attacks.

questions.question: Which of the following is the strongest password?
questions.explanation: Long passphrases with multiple words are generally more secure than complex short passwords with special characters.

questions.question: What is the primary benefit of using a password manager?
options: It generates unique, strong passwords for each account
It prevents you from forgetting passwords
questions.explanation: Password managers provide all these benefits: remembering passwords, generating unique strong passwords, and preventing password loss.

questions.question: How often should you change your passwords?
options: Only when compromised or when you suspect a breach
questions.explanation: Modern security best practices recommend changing passwords only when there's evidence of compromise, not on arbitrary schedules.

questions.question: Which email address is most likely to be a phishing attempt?
questions.explanation: Legitimate companies use their official domain. 'paypal-security.com' is not PayPal's official domain and is likely a phishing attempt.

questions.question: What is the most common goal of phishing attacks?
options: To install malware on your computer
To steal your personal information or credentials
questions.explanation: Phishing attacks primarily aim to steal personal information, login credentials, or financial data through deception.

questions.question: You receive an urgent email claiming your bank account will be closed unless you click a link. What should you do?
options: Click the link immediately to verify
Call your bank using the number on your card
Reply to the email asking for more information
Forward the email to friends to warn them
questions.explanation: Always contact your bank directly using official contact information, never through links in suspicious emails.

questions.question: Which of these is a red flag in a suspicious email?
questions.explanation: Urgent language demanding immediate action is a common tactic used by phishers to pressure victims into making hasty decisions.

questions.question: What is the primary purpose of two-factor authentication (2FA)?
options: To provide an additional layer of security
To allow multiple users on one account
questions.explanation: 2FA adds an extra layer of security by requiring a second form of verification beyond just a password.

questions.question: Which social media setting should you review regularly?
options: Privacy settings and who can see your posts
questions.explanation: Privacy settings control who can see your information and should be reviewed regularly as platforms update their features.

questions.question: What should you do before downloading an app?
options: Check the permissions the app requests
questions.explanation: Before downloading any app, you should read the description, check permissions, and read reviews to ensure it's legitimate and safe.

questions.question: What is the safest way to connect to public Wi-Fi?
options: Only visit websites you know are safe
questions.explanation: Using a VPN encrypts your internet traffic, making it much safer to use public Wi-Fi networks.

questions.question: What is the best way to protect your computer from malware?
options: Keep your operating system and software updated
Avoid downloading files from the internet
Use a combination of antivirus software, regular updates, and safe browsing habits
questions.explanation: Comprehensive protection requires multiple layers: antivirus software, regular updates, and practicing safe browsing habits.

questions.question: What should you do if you suspect your computer is infected with malware?
options: Disconnect from the internet and run a full antivirus scan
questions.explanation: If you suspect malware, disconnect from the internet to prevent data theft and run a full antivirus scan.

questions.question: Which file type is most commonly used to spread malware?
questions.explanation: Executable files (.exe) are the most common way to spread malware as they can run code on your system.
